title: Red Receives Her Mission
summary: Red's mother hands her a basket of food and instructs her to take it to her ailing grandmother, warning her to avoid strangers in the woods. Red, eager to prove her maturity and reliability, promises to take the quickest path. She sets out, determined to accomplish her task and make her mother proud.

title: The Wolf’s Proposition
summary: Red encounters the charming Wolf, who engages her in conversation and slyly asks about her destination. The Wolf, motivated by curiosity and hunger, learns about Red's grandmother and suggests Red pick some flowers to please her. Red hesitates but decides to gather flowers, believing it will brighten her grandmother’s day.

title: Wolf’s Race to Grandmother’s House
summary: The Wolf quickly takes a shortcut to Grandmother’s house, intent on reaching her before Red. Upon arrival, the Wolf deceives Grandmother and locks her in the closet. The Wolf then disguises himself in Grandmother’s clothes, motivated by the plan to surprise Red and possibly win her trust—or her heart.

title: Red’s Suspicion and Bold Entry
summary: Red arrives at the cottage and notices subtle oddities in 'Grandmother’s' appearance and voice. Suspicious but curious, Red questions the Wolf in disguise with pointed remarks, prompting the Wolf to reveal his true identity. Confronted, Red demands to know where her grandmother is, threatening to call for help.

title: The Unexpected Alliance
summary: Red bargains with the Wolf, offering to share her basket of food if he releases her grandmother unharmed. The Wolf, torn between his predatory instincts and growing affection for Red, agrees to the deal. Together, they free Grandmother, who is shocked by the alliance but accepts Red’s judgment.

title: The Woodsman’s Arrival and Decision
summary: A woodsman, hearing the commotion, bursts in ready to attack the Wolf. Red intervenes, explaining the Wolf’s change of heart and their agreement. The woodsman, skeptical but moved by Red’s conviction, decides to spare the Wolf, provided he promises never to threaten the villagers again.

title: A Promise Sealed with Trust
summary: The Wolf promises to protect Red and her family instead of harming them, motivated by his feelings for Red and desire for acceptance. Red, convinced of the Wolf’s sincerity, invites him to share the meal with her and Grandmother. The chapter ends with cautious optimism as the unlikely group sits down together, hinting at a new chapter in their relationships.
